item.label: (ii)
item.para: ensure comprehensive restrictions on the use of Australian uranium are expanded and enforced,

item.label: (iii)
item.para: withdraw uranium export agreements with nuclear weapons states that do not commit to an agreed time frame for total disarmament, and

item.label: (iv)
item.para: refuse entry to any vessel suspected of carrying nuclear weapons, or of carrying depleted uranium weapons, to any Australian port.

subdebate.1.para: Senator Stott Despoja to move on the next day of sitting:

item.para: That the Senate—

item.label: (a)
item.para: notes that:

item.label: (i)
item.para: 8 August 2005 was the 17th anniversary of the Burmese military regime’s murderous suppression of the pro-democracy movement,

item.label: (ii)
item.para: thousands of people have died and continue to die under the rule of the Burmese military, and

item.label: (iii)
item.para: Daw Aung San Suu Kyi and many hundreds of other political prisoners remain under detention within Burma; and

item.label: (b)
item.para: calls on the Government to:

item.label: (i)
item.para: make representations to the United Nations Security Council, calling on the Council to pass a strong resolution addressing the urgent need for democratic reform and greater protection of human rights in Burma,

item.label: (ii)
item.para: rethink its diplomatic relationship with Burma, and

item.label: (iii)
item.para: repeat its calls for the immediate and unconditional release of Daw Aung San Suu Kyi and all remaining political prisoners.

subdebate.1.para: Senator Stott Despoja to move on the next day of sitting:

item.para: That the Senate—

item.label: (a)
item.para: notes:

item.label: (i)
item.para: the failure of the implementation of the Special Autonomy Law in improving the lives of indigenous West Papuans,

item.label: (ii)
item.para: the Council for Indigenous Papuans, Dewan Adat Papua, has decided to ‘hand back’ the Special Autonomy Law to Jakarta on 15 August 2005,

item.label: (iii)
item.para: the unacceptable escalation of violence and intimidation, particularly in the district of Pyramid, and

item.label: (iv)
item.para: the dramatic increase in the number of Indonesian troops deployed in West Papua; and

item.label: (b)
item.para: calls on the Government to:

item.label: (i)
item.para: make representations to the Indonesian Government to reassess the implementation of autonomy in West Papua,

item.label: (ii)
item.para: make representations to the Indonesian Government to withdraw troops from West Papua,

item.label: (iii)
item.para: draw attention to ongoing human rights abuses in West Papua, and

item.label: (iv)
item.para: urge both sides to show restraint.

subdebate.1.para: Senator Kemp and Senator Lundy to move on the next day of sitting:

item.para: That the Senate—

item.label: (a)
item.para: conveys its deepest sympathies to the family and friends of Amy Gillett, Australian cyclists, who died tragically in a road accident in Germany while training with the Australian Road Cycling Team on 18 July 2005;

item.label: (b)
item.para: records its very best wishes for a full recovery to Amy’s team mates who were also involved in the accident, Louise Yaxley, Alexis Rhodes, Kate Nichols, Lorian Graham and Katie Brown; and

item.label: (c)
item.para: records its thanks to the Australian Ambassador to Germany and staff, the Australian Sports Commission, the Australian Institute of Sport and Cycling Australia for their support provided to family and friends of the cyclists involved in the accident and to the surviving cyclists.

subdebate.1.para: Senator Ellison to move on the next day of sitting:

item.para: That the following bill be introduced: A Bill for an Act relating to the implementation of the imports phase of the Integrated Cargo System, and for related purposes. Customs Amendment (Extension of Import Cut-over Time) Bill 2005.

item.para: That the order of the Senate of 17 November 2004, relating to the days of meeting of the Senate in 2005, be modified to provide that the Senate not meet on Monday, 15 August 2005 to enable senators to fully participate in the 60th anniversary VP Day celebrations in their respective states and territories.
